Package command

The command package contains all the commands that implement the ICommand interface. This makes use of the Command design pattern.
See Also:
refactoring.guru tutorial about the Command pattern
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ICommand<T>
    ICommand is the interface implemented by all commands.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AddEventTagCommand
    AddEventTagCommand allows a logged in Staff member to create a new EventTag.
    BookEventCommand
    BookEventCommand allows Consumers to book tickets for an Event.
    CancelBookingCommand
    CancelBookingCommand allows Consumers to cancel a Booking given its unique booking number.
    CancelEventCommand
    CancelEventCommand allows Staff members to cancel a previously added Event.
    CreateEventCommand
    CreateEventCommand allows Staffs to create new Events.
    GetEventDirectionsCommand
    GetEventDirectionsCommand allows a logged in Consumer to request directions to given Event.
    ListConsumerBookingsCommand
    ListConsumerBookingsCommand allows a logged-in Consumer to get a list of all their own Bookings.
    ListEventBookingsCommand
    ListEventBookingsCommand allows an event organiser (Staff) to get a list of all Bookings for a chosen Event.
    ListEventReviewsCommand
    ListEventReviewsCommand allows any user to get a list of Reviews for any Events of the given title.
    ListEventsCommand
    ListEventsCommand allows anyone to get a list of Events available on the system.
    ListEventsMaxDistanceCommand
    ListEventsMaxDistanceCommand allows a logged in Consumer to generate a list of events within a given distance.
    LoadAppStateCommand
    LoadAppStateCommand allows the logged in Staff member to import a previously saved app state.
    LoginCommand
    LoginCommand allows a previously registered User to log in to the system by providing their login details.
    LogoutCommand
    LogoutCommand allows the currently logged in User to log out
    RegisterConsumerCommand
    RegisterConsumerCommand allows users to register a new Consumer account on the system.
    RegisterStaffCommand
    RegisterStaffCommand allows users to register a new Staff account on the system.
    ReviewEventCommand
    ReviewEventCommand allows the logged in Consumer to create a new Review for a given Event.
    SaveAppStateCommand
    SaveAppStateCommand allows the logged in Staff member to save the system data to a file.
    UpdateConsumerProfileCommand
    UpdateConsumerProfileCommand allows Consumers to update their account details and change the default Covid-19 preferences.
    UpdateProfileCommand
    UpdateProfileCommand contains common behaviour shared between profile update commands
    UpdateStaffProfileCommand
    UpdateStaffProfileCommand allows Staff members to update their account details in the system.
